qas.question: Who won the women's title in 1937?
What year did June Byers retire?
What year did Mildred Burke retire?

context: The women's division of professional wrestling has maintained a recognized world champion since 1937, when <a0_0>Mildred Burke<a0_0/> won the original World Women's title. She then formed the World <a1_0>Women's Wrestling Association<a1_0/> in the early 1950s and recognized herself as the first champion, although the championship would be vacated upon her retirement in <a3_0>1956<a3_0/>. The NWA, however, ceased to acknowledge Burke as their Women's World champion in 1954, and instead acknowledged June Byers as champion after a controversial finish to a high-profile match between Burke and Byers that year. Upon Byers' retirement in <a2_0>1964<a2_0/>, The Fabulous Moolah, who won a junior heavyweight version of the NWA World Women's Championship (the predecessor to the WWE's Women's Championship) in a tournament back in 1958, was recognized by most NWA promoters as champion by default.
